alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 6:50PM MST until August 26 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River Near Gila River at Calva affecting Graham County. For the Upper Gila...including Gila River at Calva...elevated river levels are forecast Wednesday morning around daybreak. Elevated Flows below Minor flood stage will persist from Wednesday Morning through Thursday evening. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Gila River Near Gila River at Calva. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Agricultural fields flooded in bylas and geronimo areas. Portions of highway 70 near bylas threatened. Highway 70 bridge approaches near bylas threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM MST Tuesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.6 feet around daybreak Wednesday morning. It will then briefly fall to 14.1 feet, then begin to rise again to 16.3 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will eventually fall again and remain below flood stage Thursday evening. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 745 PM MST.
